TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE a person sued the applicant for defamation before ORG . On DATE the plaintiff extended his action . He claimed that the applicant should be ordered to abstain from alleging that he had stolen objects which formed part of his personal belongings and which were kept by the applicant . The plaintiff further claimed that the applicant should apologise for her above statements and that she be ordered to pay him CARDINAL NORP korunas ( SKK ) in compensation for non - pecuniary damage resulting from the interference with his personality rights .
On DATE the applicant requested the exclusion of ORG judge dealing with the case with reference to the conduct of the latter . On DATE ORG decided that ORG judge was not biased .

On DATE ORG granted the plaintiff ’s action . The applicant was ordered to revoke her statement that the plaintiff had stolen the property in question , to abstain from such statements in the future and to apologise in writing to the plaintiff . ORG further decided that the applicant had to pay SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL to the plaintiff in compensation for non - pecuniary damage and to reimburse the plaintiff ’s costs amounting to SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
On DATE the applicant appealed . She stated that the judgment had been served on her on CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the applicant submitted the reasons for her appeal .

On DATE ORG rejected the appeal on the ground that it had been lodged belatedly . The decision stated , with reference to the relevant provisions of LAW , that the first instance judgment was to be considered as having been served on DATE , that is on DATE after it had been deposited at the post office . ORG noted that the deposition of the judgment at the post office , of which the applicant was notified in writing , had been preceded by CARDINAL unsuccessful attempts to serve it on the applicant in person at her address .

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal on points of law . She relied on Section CARDINAL ) of the Code of Civil Procedure and argued that ORG conclusion concerning the date of service of the first instance judgment was erroneous .

The applicant further requested that she should be exempted from the obligation to pay the costs of the proceedings concerning her appeal on points of law and that a lawyer should be assigned to her by the court . She explained that she was handicapped and that her only income was an invalidity pension amounting to SKK DATE . The applicant concluded that her financial and social situation did not allow her to incur any costs in the context of the proceedings .

On DATE the Bánovce nad ORG exempted the applicant from the obligation to pay the court fees in respect of the proceedings on her appeal on points of law . It further dismissed her request that a lawyer be assigned to her .

In its decision ORG noted that the court fee due by the applicant amounted to SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL , that is CARDINAL of her DATE income . The court therefore considered it justified to exempt the applicant from the obligation to pay it .

As to the applicant ’s request that a lawyer be appointed to represent her , ORG established , with reference to the relevant regulations , that an advocate was entitled to charge the applicant LAW for representing her in the proceedings on her appeal on points of law . It held that the applicant could afford to pay that sum and that her DATE income would in such a case still remain over the statutory minimum which then corresponded to SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL .

On DATE the applicant appealed . She claimed that her living costs and expenditures on medicaments did not allow her to pay the fees of a lawyer . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal on the ground that it had been lodged out of time .

On DATE the applicant filed an appeal on points of law against ORG decision of DATE . She argued that she had appealed in time . The applicant also claimed that she should be exempted from the obligation to pay the court fees in respect of her appeal on points of law and that an advocate should be appointed to represent her .

On DATE ORG invited the applicant , with reference to LAW and to ORG above decision of DATE , to appoint a lawyer within DATE . The letter further stated that the proceedings would be discontinued in the event that the applicant failed to comply with the request .

The applicant received ORG letter on DATE , and on DATE she replied that she could not comply with the request within the time - limit fixed as she was to start a cure in the Piešťany spa as from DATE . The applicant further stated that she did not know when the cure would end . A certificate attached to the applicant ’s letter indicated that the cure was to DATE as from DATE .

On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings on the applicant ’s appeals on points of law . The decision stated that the applicant had been notified about the dismissal of her request for an advocate to be assigned to her by ORG on DATE . Accordingly , she had had enough time to appoint a lawyer of her own choice or , as the case might be , to ask ORG or ORG to assign a lawyer to her . ORG concluded that the applicant ’s conduct indicated that she had no genuine interest in complying with the formal requirements for her appeals on points of law to be proceeded with .

In a letter dated DATE and sent on DATE the applicant asked the president of ORG to assign a lawyer to her in the proceedings on her appeals on points of law . She explained that she was handicapped and indigent .

On DATE the vice - president of ORG replied to the applicant , with reference to LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE , that an advocate could be assigned only to persons who were denied legal assistance . The letter further stated that the applicant had not shown that advocates had refused to represent her .
On DATE the applicant again requested that the president of ORG assign a lawyer to her .
On DATE the vice - president of ORG reiterated the position set out in her letter of CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant asked ORG to assign a lawyer to her in the proceedings on her appeal on points of law against ORG decision of DATE . She explained that she was indigent and that her mobility was reduced . The applicant further stated that she would not contact an advocate directly , and that she considered indecent and discriminatory the requirement that she should show that CARDINAL advocates had refused to represent her prior to addressing her request to ORG . The applicant reiterated her request on DATE .
On DATE an enforcement officer informed the applicant that proceedings had been brought with a view to enforcing the above ORG judgment of DATE .
The applicant filed an objection to the enforcement . She argued that it had no legal ground as she had not offended the plaintiff . The applicant further contested the costs of the enforcement .

On DATE the Bánovce nad ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection to the enforcement . It found that the applicant still owed the sum in question , and there existed no impediment to the enforcement . ORG further found that the applicant ’s objection to the costs of the enforcement was justified .

On DATE the enforcement officer issued an order under which the sum due by the applicant was to be withdrawn from the applicant ’s invalidity pension . Subsequently the order was quashed as the costs of the enforcement had not been determined in it correctly .

On DATE a new enforcement order was issued . The sum owed by the applicant has been enforced by DATE instalments of SKK CARDINAL,CARDINAL deducted from her invalidity pension . The applicant was informed that the sum which had already been enforced under the above order of DATE would be deducted from the sum due by her .
On DATE the applicant requested that the enforcement proceedings be discontinued . She argued that the costs of the enforcement had been indicated erroneously in the order of CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the applicant submitted to ORG , at the latter ’s request , documents concerning her health .
On DATE ORG requested the applicant to inform it whether she had apologised to the plaintiff and abstained from further defamatory statements in his respect as ordered by the judgment of DATE .

On DATE the applicant informed the court that she had sent the plaintiff a registered letter of apology . The applicant further pointed out that the above ORG letter of DATE had been erroneously sent to her mother ’s place in ORG Bebravou and not to her permanent address in GPE .
In a separate letter of DATE the applicant complained to the Minister of ORG that ORG had failed to examine her complaint about the enforcement officer dealing with her case .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that courts may appoint a representative to a party to the proceedings , at the latter ’s request , provided that he or she meets the requirements for waiver of court fees and that such an appointment is necessary for the protection of the party ’s interests . Pursuant to paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , the president of the court ’s chamber shall appoint an advocate to represent a party in circumstances set out in the first paragraph when the protection of the party ’s interests so requires .
Pursuant to LAW ( f ) , an appeal on points of law is available when a party has been prevented , by the appellate court ’s conduct , from acting before the court .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides , inter alia , that in proceedings on an appeal on points of law the plaintiff has to be represented by an advocate or a commercial lawyer unless he or she has legal qualification .
Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ( PERSON o advokácii ) of DATE provides that everybody has the right to legal assistance and can ask any advocate for it .

Paragraph CARDINAL of LAW provides that an advocate is entitled to refuse legal assistance to a person only for serious reasons permitting the advocate to conclude that he or she can not provide such assistance in an appropriate manner . This does not apply to cases when an advocate was assigned to represent a person , for example under LAW . An advocate shall explain the reasons for which he or she refused to provide legal assistance to a client . ORG shall examine whether such a refusal was justified .
Under paragraph CARDINAL of LAW , a person whose request for legal assistance has been turned down can ask ORG to appoint an advocate to represent him or her .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , as in force since DATE , provides that citizens are entitled to legal assistance at a reduced cost or free of charge when it is justified by the client ’s personal or material situation or by other particular reasons .
